line.originaltext: 1 cup shortening
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ground black pepper
1 (2 to 3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces
Heat the shortening in a large, cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
Heat the shortening in a large, cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
line.annotation: cook(ing28, t9, ing33, "hot shortening", "heat over medium-high")

line.originaltext: In a brown paper lunch bag, combine the flour, salt, and pepper.
In a brown paper lunch bag, combine the flour, salt, and pepper.
In a brown paper lunch bag, combine the flour, salt, and pepper.
Shake two chicken pieces in the bag to coat, and place them in the skillet.
line.annotation: combine({ing32, ing34}, ing35, "coated chicken", "2 pieces at a time, shake chicken in bag")

line.originaltext: Shake two chicken pieces in the bag to coat, and place them in the skillet.
Repeat until all of the chicken is coated and in the skillet.
line.annotation: chefcheck(ing35,"all chicken coated and in skillet")

line.originaltext: Repeat until all of the chicken is coated and in the skillet.
Fry the chicken over medium-high heat until all of the pieces have been browned on both sides.
line.annotation: cook(ing36, t9, ing37, "cooked chicken", "fry over medium-high heat")

line.originaltext: Fry the chicken over medium-high heat until all of the pieces have been browned on both sides.
Turn the heat to medium-low, cover, and cook for 25 minutes.
Turn the heat to medium-low, cover, and cook for 25 minutes.
Turn the heat to medium-low, cover, and cook for 25 minutes.
Remove the lid, and increase heat to medium-high.
Remove the lid, and increase heat to medium-high.
Continue frying until chicken pieces are a deep golden brown, and the juices run clear.
